intro: Sternbergia lutea subsp. graeca, commonly known as the Greek yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny environments. Its bulbs are fleshy and store water, allowing it to survive in arid conditions. It blooms in late winter to early spring, making it one of the earliest flowering plants in the region.
